Detailed Description

Note:
This API is not for user developers, this API is only an internal API.
Warning:
All parameters in out from this API means that the parameter is a reference to a data that is complete by the call.

This API is required by CM Proxy to call CM service and shall be implemented in driver user part.

This API must be implemented by NMF OS integrator which must at the end call CM ENGINE API if existing. If kernel space can't access user space, a copying to temporary data must be implement in driver.

Define Documentation

#define NMF_OS_CHANNEL_INVALID_HANDLE   0xffffffff

Invalid value for os_channel.

Invalid value for os channel.

Typedef Documentation

typedef t_uint32 t_os_channel

Communication Component Manager internal API type.

Internal channel identification. Same as t_nmf_channel meaning but this the channel used internaly by OS Integration part

Function Documentation

PUBLIC void CM_OS_AcknowledgeEvent ( t_cm_bf_mpc2host_handle  mpc2hostId  ) 

Aknowledge a Fifo that the received event has been demarshalled.

In order to optimize call, this method don't need to be exported to user space, but must be used by CM driver.

See MPC->Host binding for seeing an integration example.

Note:
This method is not called from user space!!!
PUBLIC t_event_params_handle CM_OS_AllocEvent ( t_cm_bf_host2mpc_handle  host2mpcId  ) 

Communication User OS API.

This file contains the Communication OS API for manipulating components.

Allocate Event buffer where parameters will be marshalled. In order to optimize call, this method don't need to be exported to user space, but must be used by CM driver.

See Host->MPC binding for seeing an integration example.

Note:
This method is not called from user space!!!

PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_BindComponentToCMCore ( const t_os_channel  channel,
const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
t_uint32  fifosize,
t_nmf_mpc2host_handle  upLayerThis,
const char *  dataFileStub,
t_uint32  dataFileStubSize,
t_cm_bf_mpc2host_handle *  mpc2hostId 
)

Bind a component to the Host.

This method is called by CM Proxy. The implementation of this method must do wrapping required by OS integration and call CM_ENGINE_BindComponentToCMCore.

See MPC->Host binding for seeing an integration example.

Parameters:
[in] channel The channel on which the bind must be done
[in] client Handle of the client component
[in] requiredItfClientName Interface name of the client component. Null terminated string (Max size=MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH).
[in] fifosize Number of simultaneous communication
[in] upLayerThis Context of the upper layer (a.k.a CM Proxy)
[out] mpc2hostId Handle to the MPC->Host binding.
Note:
No implementation of this method is provided in kernel CM engine!!!

t_nmf_client_id  client,
t_cm_domain_id *  handle 
)

Public Component Manager Domain OS API.

This file contains the Component Manager OS API for manipulating domains.

Create a memory domain. Creates a domain in the CM, valid for component instantiation or memory allocation.

Parameters:
[in] domain Domain description
[in] client ClientId of the process to which the domain will be attached, NMF_CURRENT_CLIENT is a special value
[out] handle Domain handle
Exceptions:
CM_INVALID_DOMAIN_DEFINITION 
CM_INTERNAL_DOMAIN_OVERFLOW 
CM_OK 
Returns:
Error code.

const t_cm_domain_memory *  domain,
t_cm_domain_id *  handle 
)

Create a scratch memory domain. Scratch domains are used to perform overlapping allocations.

Exceptions:

CM_NO_MORE_MEMORY 
CM_OK

PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_GetMpcMemorySystemAddress ( t_cm_memory_handle  handle,
t_cm_system_address *  pSystemAddress 
)

Get the start address of the MPC memory block seen by the host CPU (physical and logical).

The logical system address returned by this method is valid only in kernel space and the physical address is accessible only from kernel space too.

See also:
OSMem "OS Memory management" for seeing an integration example.
Parameters:
[in] handle 
[out] pSystemAddress 
PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_GetRequiredComponentFiles ( t_action_to_do  action,
const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
const t_cm_instance_handle  server,
const char *  providedItfServerName,
char  fileList[][MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH],
t_uint32  listSize,
char  type[MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH],
t_uint32 *  methodNumber 
)

Repository Component Manager User OS API.

This file contains the Component Manager OS API for manipulating the components files.

Get the name(s) of the component(s) to load.

Parameters:
[in] client Handle of the client component (optional)
[in] requiredItfClientName Null terminated string (Max size=MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH) (optional).
[in] server Handle of the server component (optional)
[in] providedItfServerName Null terminated string (Max size==MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH) (optional).
[out] fileList List of required component(s).
[in,out] listSize Initial size of the list as input. Updated with the number of entries really used.
[out] type Interface type of the client required or server provided interface. Null terminated string (Max size=MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH) (optional) .
[out] methodNumber Number of method in the interface type of the client required interface. (only used when called from CM_BindComponentToUser) (optional)
Note:
It returns the component(s) name(s) to load, depending on the first four parameters.
  • If all 4 are NULL, it returns the name of the Executive Engine components to load
  • If 'client' is NULL, it returns the name of the required components for a Bind From CMCore.
  • If 'server' is NULL, it returns the name of the required components for a Bind To CMCore.
  • If none is NULL, it returns the name of the required components for an asynchronous binding

The names are returned in fileList, whose initial size is specified in listSize. (sizeList must be the number of provided entries of MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH length If not enough space is provided, CM_NO_MORE_MEMORY is returned

sizeList is updated with the number entries really filled.

This method is also used to retrieve the interface type when called from CM_BindComponentToUser and CM_BindComponentFromUser and the number of methods when called from CM_BindComponentToUser.

PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_InstantiateComponent ( const char  templateName[MAX_TEMPLATE_NAME_LENGTH],
t_cm_domain_id  domainId,
t_nmf_ee_priority  priority,
const char  localName[MAX_COMPONENT_NAME_LENGTH],
const char *  dataFile,
t_uint32  dataFileSize,
t_cm_instance_handle *  component 
)

Components Component Manager Operating System API.

This file contains the Component Manager Operating System API for manipulating components.

Instantiate a new component.

Parameters:
[in] templateName templateName Null terminated string (Max size=MAX_TEMPLATE_NAME_LENGTH)
[in] domainId Domain
[in] priority Component priority
[in] localName Null terminated string (Max size=MAX_COMPONENT_NAME_LENGTH)
[in] dataFile Data File (null if take in cache), according your OS integration, don't forgot to do CopyFromUser
[in] dataFileSize Data File Size
[out] component Component handle
PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_PushComponent ( const char *  name,
const void *  data,
t_cm_size  size 
)

Push a component into the CM Component Cache.

Parameters:
[in] name Component name, null terminated string (Max size=MAX_INTERFACE_TYPE_NAME_LENGTH)
[in] data Pointer to _user_ data of the component.
[in] size Size of the data.
[in] locked Specify if the component data must be persistent
Note:
Push a component in the Component Cache The 'data' must be provided such a way that they can be freed by a call to OSAL_Free() The caller doesn't need and must NOT free the data, even in case of failure.
PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_PushEvent ( t_cm_bf_host2mpc_handle  host2mpcId,
t_event_params_handle  h,
t_uint32  methodIndex 
)

Push a event in Fifo.

In order to optimize call, this method don't need to be exported to user space, but must be used by CM driver.

See Host->MPC binding for seeing an integration example.

Note:
This method is not called from user space!!!
PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_PushEventWithSize ( t_cm_bf_host2mpc_handle  host2mpcId,
t_event_params_handle  h,
t_uint32  size,
t_uint32  methodIndex 
)

Push a event in Fifo.

In order to optimize call, this method need to be exported to user space and must be implemented by CM driver.

See Host->MPC binding for seeing an integration example.

Note:
No implementation of this method is provided in kernel CM engine!!!

PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_SetMode ( t_cm_cmd_id  aCmdID,

Configuration Component Manager User OS API.

This file contains the Configuration CM OS API for manipulating CM.

Dynamically set some debug parameters of the CM

Parameters:
[in] aCmdID The command for the parameter to update
[in] aParam The actual value to set for the given command

PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_UnbindComponentFromCMCore ( t_cm_bf_host2mpc_handle  host2mpcId  ) 

Unbind a component from the Host.

Parameters:
[in] host2mpcId 
PUBLIC t_cm_error CM_OS_UnbindComponentToCMCore ( const t_os_channel  channel,
const t_cm_instance_handle  client,
const char *  requiredItfClientName,
t_nmf_mpc2host_handle *  upLayerThis 
)

Unbind a component to the Host.

Parameters:
[in] channel The channel on which the bind has been done
[in] client Handle of the client component
[in] requiredItfClientName Interface name of the client component. Null terminated string (Max size=MAX_INTERFACE_NAME_LENGTH).
[out] upLayerThis Return the upLayerThis handle that have been gived during call to CM_OS_BindComponentToCMCore. The purpose of this information was to allow easy free of user data without need to memorize them by top level user.
